title: Does the volume of gas increase when gases expand? - Quora

response.answer_text: If the container has a piston or some other means of maintaining constant pressure, then it will expand as the pressure does work on the piston, until some of the added energy has ... To a good approximation most gases follow the Ideal Gas equation PV=nRT Increasing the temperature means the PV product must increase.
Volume means the space occupied by a substance such as a gas. So, if a gas expands, the gas occupies more space. So, of course, the volume expands.
Yes, the volume of gas increases if the gas i expands. In an adiabatic process, the internal energy as decreases as the gas expands because that energy is used to increase the volume of the gas.

Provided that there is no constraint on the volume then a free gas will expand and become diluted ad infinitum. If heat is applied then the gas will expand faster. And if there is a volume constraint then the effect of heat is to increase pressure in accordance with Charles’s Law.
